custom_item_1.description: Salesforce.com : Network-Based Security - 'Trusted IP Ranges exist'
custom_item_1.info: This setting controls the trusted IP ranges for your organization.
custom_item_1.solution: Define the trusted ranges of IPs where users should be allowed to login from.
custom_item_1.xsl_stmt: Trusted IP Ranges = Start:End:Trusted IP Ranges = NONE FOUND

custom_item_2.description: Salesforce.com : Network-Based Security - 'Trusted IP Ranges exist'
custom_item_2.xsl_stmt: Trusted IP Ranges = Start:End:Trusted IP Ranges = NONE FOUND

custom_item_3.description: Salesforce.com : Network-Based Security - 'Trusted IP Range has been defined'
custom_item_3.info: NOTE: Update START_IP and END_IP with the appropriate values for the local environment.
custom_item_3.solution: Define the trusted ranges of IPs where users should be allowed to login from.
custom_item_3.xsl_stmt: Trusted IP Ranges = Start:End:Trusted IP Ranges = NONE FOUND

custom_item_4.info:
The list of IPs used for login should be reviewed for uknown addresses.

  NOTE: Nessus has provided the target output to assist in reviewing the benchmark to ensure target compliance.
custom_item_4.solution: Logins from unknown addresses should be reviewed.
custom_item_4.query: SELECT SourceIp from LoginIp GROUP BY SourceIp

custom_item_5.description: Salesforce.com : Securing Data Access - 'DashboardMobile iPad access'
custom_item_5.info: NOTE: Update DASHBOARD_MOBILE_IPAD with the appropriate value for the local environment
custom_item_5.solution: If iPad devices are not in use in your organization then their access should be disabled.
custom_item_5.xsl_stmt: Dashboard Mobile iPad Access =Dashboard Mobile iPad Access = NOT FOUND

custom_item_6.description: Salesforce.com : Administrator Access - 'No System Administrator accounts have been created since the last scan'
custom_item_6.info: Change SCAN_INTERVAL to the appropriate value for the local environment.
custom_item_6.solution: Review any administrators created since the last scan to verify their validity.
custom_item_6.xsl_stmt: System Administrator =() Created On:System Administrator = NONE FOUNDSystem Administrator = NONE FOUND
custom_item_6.query: SELECT user.id, user.Email, user.FirstName, user.LastName, user.profile.name , user.profile.LastModifiedDate, user.Username, user.IsActive, user.CreatedDate, user.LastModifiedDate FROM user, user.profile WHERE (user.profile.name = 'System Administrator') AND (user.CreatedDate >= LAST_N_DAYS:@SCAN_INTERVAL@)

custom_item_7.description: Salesforce.com : Administrator Access - 'No System Administrator accounts have been modified since the last scan'
custom_item_7.info: Change SCAN_INTERVAL to the appropriate value for the local environment.
custom_item_7.solution: Review any administrators accoutns which have been modified since the last scan to verify the validity of the changes.
custom_item_7.xsl_stmt: System Administrator =() Modified On:System Administrator = NONE FOUNDSystem Administrator = NONE FOUND
custom_item_7.query: SELECT user.id, user.Email, user.FirstName, user.LastName, user.profile.name , user.profile.LastModifiedDate, user.Username, user.IsActive, user.CreatedDate, user.LastModifiedDate FROM user, user.profile WHERE (user.profile.name = 'System Administrator') AND (user.LastModifiedDate >= LAST_N_DAYS:@SCAN_INTERVAL@)

custom_item_8.description: Salesforce.com : User Access - 'No new users have been created since the last scan'
custom_item_8.info: Change SCAN_INTERVAL to the appropriate value for the local environment.
custom_item_8.solution: Review any users created since the last scan to verify their validity.
custom_item_8.query: SELECT Name,CreatedBy.Name,CreatedDate FROM User WHERE CreatedDate > LAST_N_DAYS:@SCAN_INTERVAL@

custom_item_9.description: Salesforce.com : User Access - Users have only been modified by known administrators
custom_item_9.info: Users should only be modified by a known administrator.
custom_item_9.solution: Review users and their last modification to verify that the modifications were from a legitimate source.

custom_item_10.description: Salesforce.com : Object Permissions - 'DefaultAccountAccess should not be Public Read/Write or Public Read/Write/Transfer'
custom_item_10.info: The default access to Accounts should not be set to edit.
custom_item_10.solution: Configure the default access to a value other than edit.
custom_item_10.xsl_stmt: Default Account Access =Default Account Access = NOT FOUND

custom_item_11.description: Salesforce.com : Object Permissions - 'DefaultContactAccess should not be Public Read/Write or Public Read/Write/Transfer'
custom_item_11.info: The default access to Contacts should not be set to edit.
custom_item_11.solution: Configure the default access to a value other than edit.
custom_item_11.xsl_stmt: Default Contact Access =Default Contact Access = NOT FOUND

custom_item_12.description: Salesforce.com : Object Permissions - 'DefaultOpportunityAccess should not be Public Read/Write or Public Read/Write/Transfer'
custom_item_12.info: The default access to Opportunities should not be set to edit.

custom_item_12.xsl_stmt: Default Opportunity Access =Default Opportunity Access = NOT FOUND

custom_item_13.description: Salesforce.com : Object Permissions - 'DefaultLeadAccess should not be Public Read/Write or Public Read/Write/Transfer'
custom_item_13.info: The default access to Leads should not be set to edit.
custom_item_13.solution: Configure the default access to a value other than edit.

custom_item_14.description: Salesforce.com : Object Permissions - 'DefaultCaseAccess should not be Public Read/Write or Public Read/Write/Transfer'

custom_item_14.solution: Configure the default access to a value other than edit.
custom_item_14.xsl_stmt: Default Case Access =Default Case Access = NOT FOUND

custom_item_15.description: Salesforce.com : Object Permissions - 'DefaultCalendarAccess should not be Show Details or Show Details and Add Events'
custom_item_15.info: The default access to Calendars should not show details.
custom_item_15.solution: Configure the default access to a value that does not include details.
custom_item_15.xsl_stmt: Default Case Access =Default Case Access = NOT FOUND

custom_item_16.description: Salesforce.com : Object Permissions - 'DefaultPricebookAccess should not be Use'
custom_item_16.info: The default access to Pricebook should not be use.
custom_item_16.solution: Configure the default access to a value other than use.
custom_item_16.xsl_stmt: Default Pricebook Access =Default Pricebook Access = NOT FOUND

custom_item_17.description: Salesforce.com : Object Permissions - 'DefaultCampaignAccess should not be Public Full Access or Public Read/Write'
custom_item_17.info: The default access to Campaigns should not be use.
custom_item_17.solution: Configure the default access to a value other than Full Access or Read/Write.
custom_item_17.xsl_stmt: Default Campaign Access =Default Campaign Access = NOT FOUND

custom_item_18.description: SalesForce.com : User Permissions - 'Review Active System Administrators'
custom_item_18.info: If an active system administrators is no longer needed they should be removed.
custom_item_18.xsl_stmt: Active System Administrator =()Active System Administrator = NONE FOUNDSystem Administrator = NONE FOUND
custom_item_18.query: SELECT user.id, user.Email, user.FirstName, user.LastName, user.profile.name , user.profile.LastModifiedDate, user.Username, user.IsActive, user.CreatedDate, user.LastModifiedDate FROM user, user.profile WHERE user.profile.name = 'System Administrator'

custom_item_19.description: SalesForce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Active Users'
custom_item_19.info: If an active user is no longer needed they should be removed.

custom_item_20.description: SalesForce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Inactive Users'
custom_item_20.info: If an inactive user is no longer needed they should be removed.

custom_item_21.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review user types'
custom_item_21.info: The user type describes the category of user license.

custom_item_22.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Marketing Users'
custom_item_22.info: Indicates whether the user is enabled to manage campaigns in the user interface

custom_item_23.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Call Center Auto-Login Users'
custom_item_23.info: Indicates whether the user is enabled to use the auto login feature of Salesforce CRM Call Center
custom_item_23.solution: Review the Call Center Auto-Login users.

custom_item_24.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Chatter Answers Users'
custom_item_24.info: Indicates whether the portal user is enabled to use the Chatter Answers

custom_item_25.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Force.com Flow Users'
custom_item_25.info: Indicates whether the user can run flows or not

custom_item_26.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Salesforce Knowledge Users'
custom_item_26.info: Indicates whether the user is enabled to use Salesforce Knowledge

custom_item_27.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Apex Mobile User'
custom_item_27.info: Indicates whether the user is allocated one Salesforce Classic license. The Salesforce Classic license grants the user access to the Salesforce Classic application on supported mobile devices.

custom_item_28.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Offline User'
custom_item_28.info: Indicates whether the user is enabled to use Offline Edition

custom_item_29.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Salesforce CRM Content User'
custom_item_29.info: Indicates whether the user is allocated one Salesforce CRM Content User License
custom_item_29.solution: Review the Salesforce CRM Content users.

custom_item_30.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Site.com Contributor User'
custom_item_30.info: Indicates whether the user is allocated one Site.com Contributor feature license

custom_item_31.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Site.com Publisher User'
custom_item_31.info: ndicates whether the user is allocated one Site.com Publisher feature license

custom_item_32.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Salesforce console User'
custom_item_32.info: Indicates whether the user can use the Salesforce console.

custom_item_33.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Wireless User'
custom_item_33.info: Indicates whether the user is enabled to use Wireless Edition.

custom_item_34.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Work.com User'
custom_item_34.info: Indicates whether the Work.com feature is enabled for the user.

custom_item_35.info: This setting controls the length of time until user passwords expire and must be changed.
custom_item_35.solution: Password expiration should be set to a value of 90 days or less.

custom_item_36.info: This setting controls the number of previous passwords saved for users so that they must always reset a new, unique password.
custom_item_36.solution: Password history should be set to a value of 3 or greater.

custom_item_37.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Password Policies - 'minimum password length >= 8'
custom_item_37.info: This setting controls the minimum number of characters required for a password.
custom_item_37.solution: Password length should be set to a value of 8 or greater.

custom_item_38.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Password Policies - 'Must mix numbers, uppercase and lowercase letters, and special characters'
custom_item_38.info: This setting controls the requirement for which types of characters must be used in a user's password.
custom_item_38.solution: Passwords should contain a mix of upper and lower case characters in addition to numbers and special characters.

custom_item_39.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Password Policies - 'password question cannot contain password'
custom_item_39.info: This setting controls the restriction on whether the answer to the password hint question can contain the password itself.
custom_item_39.solution: The password hint should not include the users password.

custom_item_40.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Password Policies - 'invalid login attempts <= 5'
custom_item_40.info: This setting controls the number of login failures allowed for a user before they become locked out.
custom_item_40.solution: The login attempts value should be set to a value of 5 or less.

custom_item_41.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Password Policies - 'lockout period >= 30 minutes'
custom_item_41.info: This setting controls the duration of the login lockout after a number of invalid login attempts.
custom_item_41.solution: The lockout value should be set to a value of 30 minutes or longer or forever requiring it be manually unlocked by an administrator.

custom_item_42.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Password Policies - 'Obscure secret answer for password resets = true'
custom_item_42.info: This setting hides the secret answer associated with a password.
custom_item_42.solution: Where possible the secret answer should be obscured. NOTE: If your organization uses the Microsoft Input Method Editor (IME) with the input mode set to Hiragana, when you type ASCII characters they're converted into Japanese characters in normal text fields. However, the IME does not work properly in fields with obscured text. If your organization's users cannot properly enter their passwords or other values after enabling this feature, disable the feature.
custom_item_42.xsl_stmt: Obscure Secret Question =Obscure Secret Question = NOT FOUND

custom_item_43.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Password Policies - 'Minimum 1 day password lifetime'
custom_item_43.info: This setting controls whether a one-day minimum password lifetime is required.
custom_item_43.solution: A minimum 1 day password liftime prevents users from rotating password too quickly.
custom_item_43.xsl_stmt: Minumum Password Lifetime =Minumum Password Lifetime = NOT FOUND

custom_item_44.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Review Users that have not changed their password recently'
custom_item_44.info: NOTE: Update PASSWORD_CHANGE to the appropriate value for the local environment
custom_item_44.query: SELECT Name,LastPasswordChangeDate FROM User where LastPasswordChangeDate != LAST_N_DAYS:@PASSWORD_CHANGE@

custom_item_45.info: If a user has the password never expires permission enabled it should be documented and reviewed.
custom_item_45.solution: Review any users with the password never expires permission.
custom_item_45.query: SELECT Name, (SELECT PermissionSet.PermissionsPasswordNeverExpires FROM PermissionSetAssignments) FROM User

custom_item_46.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Session Timeout <= 2 hours'
custom_item_46.info: This setting controls the length of time after which users without activity are prompted to log out or continue working.
custom_item_46.solution: The user timeout setting should be set to a value of 2 hours or less.

custom_item_47.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Disable timeout warning = false'
custom_item_47.info: This setting controls whether the session timeout warning popup is disabled or enabled.
custom_item_47.solution: Set the value of the timeout warning according to the local security policy.

custom_item_48.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Force logout on timeout = true'
custom_item_48.info: This setting controls whether sessions time out for inactive users, current sessions become invalid. Browsers are automatically refreshed and return to the login page. To access the organization again when this occurs, users must log in again.
custom_item_48.solution: Set the value of forceLogoutOnSessionTimeout to true.

custom_item_49.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Lock session to IP = true'
custom_item_49.info: This setting controls whether user sessions are locked to the IP address from which the user logged in.
custom_item_49.solution: Set the value of lockSessionsToIp to true.
custom_item_49.xsl_stmt: Lock Session To IP =Lock Session To IP = NOT FOUND

custom_item_50.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Force relogin after Login-As-User = true'
custom_item_50.info: This setting controls whether an administrator that is logged in as another user is required to log in again to their original session, after logging out as the secondary user.
custom_item_50.solution: Set the value of forceRelogin to true.

custom_item_51.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Use POST requests for cross-domain sessions = true'
custom_item_51.info: This setting controls whether cross-domain session information is exchanged using a POST request instead of a GET request, such as when a user is using a Visualforce page. In this context, POST requests are more secure than GET requests.
custom_item_51.solution: Set the value of enablePostForSessions to true.
custom_item_51.xsl_stmt: POST For Sessions =POST For Sessions = NOT FOUND

custom_item_52.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Enable caching and autocomplete = false'
custom_item_52.info: This setting controls whether the user's browser is allowed to store user names and auto-fill the User Name field on the login page.
custom_item_52.solution: Set the value of enableCacheAndAutocomplete to false.
custom_item_52.xsl_stmt: Enable Cache And Autocomplete =Enable Cache And Autocomplete = NOT FOUND

custom_item_53.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Enable SMS-based identity confirmation = true'
custom_item_53.info: This setting controls whether users can receive a one-time PIN delivered via SMS.
custom_item_53.solution: Set the value of enableSMSIdentity to true.
custom_item_53.xsl_stmt: Enable SMS Identity =Enable SMS Identity = NOT FOUND

custom_item_54.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Enable clickjack protection for setup pages = true'
custom_item_54.info: This setting controls whether clickjack protection for setup pages is enabled.
custom_item_54.solution: Set the value of enableClickjackSetup to true.
custom_item_54.xsl_stmt: Enable Clickjack Setup =Enable Clickjack Setup = NOT FOUND

custom_item_55.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Enable clickjack protection for non-setup Salesforce pages = true'
custom_item_55.info: This setting controls whether clickjack protection for non-setup Salesforce pages is enabled.
custom_item_55.solution: Set the value of enableClickjackNonsetupSFDC to true.
custom_item_55.xsl_stmt: Enable Clickjack SaleForce nonSetup =Enable Clickjack SaleForce nonSetup = NOT FOUND

custom_item_56.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Enable clickjack protection for non-setup customer Visualforce pages = true'
custom_item_56.info: This setting controls whether clickjack protection for non-setup customer pages is enabled.
custom_item_56.solution: Set the value of enableClickjackNonsetupUser to true.
custom_item_56.xsl_stmt: Enable Clickjack User nonSetup =Enable Clickjack User nonSetup = NOT FOUND

custom_item_58.info: Review the list of SSO providers in use.
custom_item_58.solution: Review the list of SSO providers in use.
custom_item_58.xsl_stmt: Auth Providers In Use =Auth ProvidersAuth Providers In Use = NONE FOUND

custom_item_96.info: This is the Send Client Credentials in Header value used by the OpenIdConnect Auth Provider.
custom_item_96.solution: Review the Send Client Credentials in Header value in use.
custom_item_96.xsl_stmt: OpenIdConnect Send Client Credentials In Header =()OpenIdConnect Send Client Credentials In Header = NONE FOUND

custom_item_97.description: Salesforce.com : AuthConfig - 'Auth Providers = OpenIdConnect Error URL'
custom_item_97.info: This is the Error URL used by the OpenIdConnect Auth Provider.
custom_item_97.solution: Review the Error URL in use.
custom_item_97.xsl_stmt: OpenIdConnect Error URL =()OpenIdConnect Error URL = NONE FOUND

custom_item_98.description: Salesforce.com : AuthConfig - 'Auth Providers = OpenIdConnect Execution User ID'
custom_item_98.info: This is the Execution User ID used by the OpenIdConnect Auth Provider.
custom_item_98.solution: Review the Execution User ID in use.
custom_item_98.xsl_stmt: OpenIdConnect Execution User ID =()OpenIdConnect Execution User ID = NONE FOUND

custom_item_99.description: Salesforce.com : Monitoring Login History - 'No users are password locked'
custom_item_99.info: Any locked users should be reviewed by an administrator.
custom_item_99.solution: Review the locked users and either unlock them or if they are not needed remove them.

custom_item_100.description: Salesforce.com : Monitoring Login History - 'No users are frozen'
custom_item_100.info: Any frozen users should be reviewed by an administrator.
custom_item_100.solution: Review the frozen users and remove any users that are not needed.

custom_item_101.info: Any inactive users should be reviewed by an administrator.
custom_item_101.solution: Inactive users should be reviewed periodically and unnecessary users removed.

custom_item_102.description: Salesforce.com : Monitoring Login History - 'Inactive System Administrators'
custom_item_102.info: Any inactive System Administrators should be reviewed.
custom_item_102.solution: Inactive System Administrators should be reviewed and unnecessary administrators removed.
custom_item_102.xsl_stmt: Inactive System Administrator =()Inactive System Administrator = NONE FOUNDSystem Administrator = NONE FOUND
custom_item_102.query: SELECT user.id, user.Email, user.FirstName, user.LastName, user.profile.name , user.profile.LastModifiedDate, user.Username, user.IsActive, user.CreatedDate, user.LastModifiedDate FROM user, user.profile WHERE user.profile.name = 'System Administrator'

custom_item_103.description: Salesforce.com : Monitoring Login History - 'Users that have not logged in'
custom_item_103.info: Any users that have not logged in should be reviewed by an administrator.
custom_item_103.solution: Users that have not logged in and are not required should be removed.
custom_item_103.xsl_stmt: User Not Logged In =User Not Logged In = NONE

custom_item_104.query: SELECT CronExpression, CronJobDetailId, EndTime, NextFireTime, OwnerId, PreviousFireTime, StartTime, State, TimesTriggered, TimeZoneSidKey from CronTrigger

custom_item_105.description: Salesforce.com : CronTrigger - 'Cron Jobs with Status of ERROR'
custom_item_105.info: Any Cron jobs in the ERROR status should be reviewed and the problem should be corrected.
custom_item_105.solution: Review the list of SSO providers in use.
custom_item_105.query: SELECT CronExpression, CronJobDetailId, EndTime, NextFireTime, OwnerId, PreviousFireTime, StartTime, State, TimesTriggered, TimeZoneSidKey from CronTrigger

custom_item_106.description: Salesforce.com : CronTrigger - 'Cron Jobs with Status of BLOCKED'
custom_item_106.info: Any Cron jobs in the BLOCKED status should be reviewed and the problem should be corrected.
custom_item_106.solution: Review the list of SSO providers in use.
custom_item_106.query: SELECT CronExpression, CronJobDetailId, EndTime, NextFireTime, OwnerId, PreviousFireTime, StartTime, State, TimesTriggered, TimeZoneSidKey from CronTrigger

custom_item_107.xsl_stmt: Email Services in Use =Email Services in Use = NONE FOUND

custom_item_108.info: This setting indicates what the email service does with messages received at an email address that is inactive.
custom_item_108.solution: Set the value to an appropriate value based on your local policies.

custom_item_109.info: This setting indicates the types of attachments the email service accepts.
custom_item_109.solution: Set the value to an appropriate value based on your local policies.

custom_item_110.info: This setting configures the email service to verify the legitimacy of the sending server before processing a message.
custom_item_110.solution: Set the value of IsAuthenticationRequired to true.

custom_item_112.info: This setting indicates what the email service does with messages that fail or do not support any of the authentication protocols if the IsAuthenticationRequired field is true.
custom_item_112.solution: Set the value to an appropriate value based on your local policies.

custom_item_113.info: This setting indicates what the email service does with messages received from senders who are not listed in the AuthorizedSenders field on either the email service or email service address.
custom_item_113.solution: Set the value to an appropriate value based on your local policies.

custom_item_114.info: This setting indicates what the email service does with messages it receives when the email service itself is inactive.
custom_item_114.solution: Set the value to an appropriate value based on your local policies.

custom_item_115.info: When incoming email messages can't be processed, indicates whether error notification email messages are routed to a chosen address instead of the senders.
custom_item_115.solution: Set the value of IsErrorRoutingEnabled to true and configure an error routing email address.

custom_item_116.info: This setting indicates whether the email service converts text attachments to binary files.
custom_item_116.solution: Set the value of IsTextAttachmentsAsBinary to false.

custom_item_117.info: Configures the email service to use Transport Layer Security (TLS), a protocol for secure email communication, to ensure the security and authenticity of inbound email.
custom_item_117.solution: Set the value of IsTlsRequired to true.

custom_item_118.info: This setting indicates what the email service does with messages if the total number of messages processed by all email services combined has reached the daily limit for your organization.
custom_item_118.solution: Set the value to an appropriate value based on your local policies.

custom_item_119.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Enable CSRF protection on GET requests on non-setup pages = true'
custom_item_119.info: This setting controls whether Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protection on GET requests on non-setup pages is enabled
custom_item_119.solution: Set the value of enableCSRFOnGet to true.
custom_item_119.xsl_stmt: Enable CSRF GET =Enable CSRF GET = NOT FOUND

custom_item_120.description: Salesforce.com : Setting Session Security - 'Enable CSRF protection on POST requests on non-setup pages = true'
custom_item_120.info: This setting controls whether Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protection on POST requests on non-setup pages is enabled
custom_item_120.solution: Set the value of enableCSRFOnPost to true.
custom_item_120.xsl_stmt: Enable CSRF POST =Enable CSRF POST = NOT FOUND

custom_item_121.description: Salesforce.com : Data Access Control - 'Enable CSRF protection on GET requests on non-setup pages = true'
custom_item_121.info: This setting controls whether Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protection on GET requests on non-setup pages is enabled
custom_item_121.solution: Set the value of enableCSRFOnGet to true.
custom_item_121.xsl_stmt: Enable CSRF GET =Enable CSRF GET = NOT FOUND
